The CameraControlProperty enumeration specifies a setting on a camera.

member.name: CameraControlProperty.CameraControl_Pan
member.summary: Specifies the camera's pan setting, in degrees. Values range from –180 to +180, with the default set to zero. Positive values are clockwise from the origin (the camera rotates clockwise when viewed from above), and negative values are counterclockwise from the origin.

member.name: CameraControlProperty.CameraControl_Tilt
member.summary: Specifies the camera's tilt setting, in degrees. Values range from –180 to +180, with the default set to zero. Positive values point the imaging plane up, and negative values point the imaging plane down.

member.name: CameraControlProperty.CameraControl_Roll
member.summary: Specifies the camera's roll setting, in degrees. Values range from –180 to +180, with the default set to zero. Positive values cause a clockwise rotation of the camera along the image-viewing axis, and negative values cause a counterclockwise rotation of the camera.

member.name: CameraControlProperty.CameraControl_Zoom
member.summary: Specifies the camera's zoom setting, in millimeters. Values range from 10 to 600, and the default is specific to the device.

member.name: CameraControlProperty.CameraControl_Iris
member.summary: Specifies the camera's iris setting, in units of fₛₜₒₚ* 10.

member.name: CameraControlProperty.CameraControl_Focus
member.summary: Specifies the camera's focus setting, as the distance to the optimally focused target, in millimeters. The range and default value are specific to the device.
